gnu.gui
Class AbstractOptionPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gnu.gui.AbstractOptionPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
OptionPane, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
BeautifierOptions, EditorOptions, GeneralOptions, JBrowseOptionPane, PrintOptions, StylesOptions, UndoOptions
public class AbstractOptionPane
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements OptionPane

Abstract implementation of the OptionPane interface.

Serialized Form

AbstractOptionPane

Parameters:

Method Detail

isCacheable

public boolean isCacheable()
Description copied from interface: OptionPane
This is implemented in AbstractOptionPane and returns false by default; if your plugin has a working load() method (not the one provided by AbstractOptionPane), you must override it as public boolean isCacheable() {return true;} It is not allowed to return different values.

Specified by:
isCacheable in interface OptionPane

load

public void load()
Description copied from interface: OptionPane
When the user closes the option dialog by clicking cancel, the settings have to be reloaded next time the dialog appears, so this method is called. For old plugins, however, it won't be called, since the default implementation of isCacheable returns false, and the pane will be completely rebuilt. If you implement it, note that the constructor or however the createOptionPanes method of your plugin must call it. The constructor should not contain the code to load values; only this method should.

Specified by:
load in interface OptionPane

addComponent

protected void addComponent(java.lang.String label,
                            java.awt.Component comp)
Adds a labeled component in the pane. All the components are placed on bottom of each other (vertically sorted).

Parameters:
label - The label to be displayed next to the component
comp - The component to be added

addComponent

protected void addComponent(java.awt.Component comp)
Does the same as addComponent(String, Component) but don't add a label next to the component.

Parameters:
comp - The component to be added

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Overrides default getName() method. Needed by tabbed panes to display a title on the parent tab.

Specified by:
